name: Enhanced Rug Puller Intelligence Database
description: Comprehensive rug puller blocklist with funding sources, serial patterns, and network detection for xDEX platform

evidence: LP rug puller - Removed all liquidity

phase1RugPullers.description: 59 rug pullers detected in Phase 1 scan (first 70 tokens)
phase1RugPullers.status: Confirmed - Detailed data from original scan
commonPatterns: LP removal within 24-72 hours of launch
New wallet deployers with no transaction history
Popular meme coin names (PEPE, DOGE, SHIB, etc.)
phase1RugPullers.note: The original comprehensive scan identified 59 additional rug pullers. All were marked as CRITICAL risk with confirmed LP removal. Detailed deployer addresses available in scan logs.

suspiciousFunders.description: Master wallet that funded multiple rug puller deployers
evidence: 3 of those deployers confirmed rug pulls

scamNetworks.name: xDEX Phase 1 Rug Ring
scamNetworks.description: Coordinated rug pull operation targeting xDEX early tokens
networkPatterns: Funding chain: Master → Deployer → Token creation → LP removal
Timing: Deploy on Monday-Wednesday, rug by Friday
Token names: Popular meme coin names
scamNetworks.recommendation: Block all wallets in this network immediately

lpRemoval.description: Detect deployers who removed liquidity from DEX pools
indicators: Rapid dump of tokens after LP removal

newWalletDetection.description: Flag deployers with newly created wallets (< 7 days)

serialDeployerDetection.description: Identify deployers who created multiple tokens

fundingChainAnalysis.description: Trace wallet funding sources to identify networks
indicators: Multiple deployers funded by same source

networkMapping.description: Map connections between related scam wallets

integrationGuide.description: How to integrate this blocklist into your security scanner
steps: 1. Load this JSON file on application startup
2. When scanning a token, extract the deployer address
4. Check deployer's funding source against suspiciousFunders
5. Check if deployer or funder is part of any scamNetworks
6. Calculate enhanced risk score based on findings

checkDeployer.description: Check if deployer is known rug puller

checkFunder.description: Check if address funded rug pullers

checkNetwork.description: Check if address is part of scam network

basicCheck.code:
const rugger = blocklist.knownRugPullers.find(r => r.deployer === deployerAddress);
if (rugger) { /* Show warning */ }

fundingCheck.code:
const funder = blocklist.suspiciousFunders.find(f => f.funderAddress === fundingSource);
if (funder) { /* Flag as high risk */ }

networkCheck.code:
const network = blocklist.scamNetworks.find(n => n.deployerWallets.includes(deployer) || n.masterWallets.includes(funder));
if (network) { /* Critical warning */ }

sources: Network analysis of existing rug pullers

reportingMechanism.howToReport: Submit new rug pulls through GitHub issues or email
reportingMechanism.verificationProcess: All submissions verified through on-chain analysis before adding to blocklist

legalDisclaimer: This blocklist is provided for informational and security purposes only. While we strive for accuracy, users should always conduct their own research (DYOR) before making investment decisions. Past rug pull behavior is a strong indicator but not a guarantee of future behavior. The creators of this blocklist are not liable for any losses incurred.
